channel.title: 3DScanning on SHELTRON Visuals
channel.description: Recent content in 3DScanning on SHELTRON Visuals

item.title: LiDAR Processing
item.description: surface reconstruction from point clouds {% for image in site.static_files %} {% if image.path contains page.imageDir %} {% if myArray contains image.path %} {% else %} {% assign myArray = myArray | push: image.path %} {% endif %} {% endif %} {% endfor %} Around Congress ave in Austin, TX LiDAR Processing Experiments Early 2016 I bought a LiDAR scan of all of Travis county! This seemed super cool, but visualizing it was hard since the only option is really just to color code based on elevation, because there’s no information about surfaces.

item.title: LiDAR Processing pt.2
item.description: more experiments in point cloud reconstruction [Texas State Capitol in Austin] Issues from last time : Tile Artifacts [Bottom side of mesh] First off tried to classify the edges of a mesh and remove the outer shell parts. That’s a ton of triangles I could save! Then started doing a k - nearest neighbors search between neighboring meshes, and try to tesselate those. But because these has been decimated the vertices were irregular leading to inconsistent merging.
